content.description: Climb arete-like feature straight up tall with easy top out. Groove to the right is off.
content.location: This is one of two problems on the Cuckoo's Nest boulder right behind the hero boulder on the opposite side as hero.

content.description: Stand start left above sheer face cave with hands right over one another on arete, heel hook obvious jug (if cant reach start holds jump to jug and start there) move up arete with slopers/pinches, move to shelfy crack, up to horn for easy topout. Highball pad recommended. One of the easier topouts in the area. Harder the shorter you are.
content.location: If you're facing the starting move for "Scarecrow" boulder, will be directly on your back, about 20-30 feet away.

content.description:
"Start with high holds. Crimp through tiny intro moves to gain water groove holds and move to the top." 

  -SCC topo, Joe at First Avenue Rocks
content.location: Lower Area H2 in SCC topo

content.description: Start on crimp rail on left side of cave.  Dyno up and to the right to grab the flake.  Then continue up for the easy top out.
content.location: At cave on D boulder. Next to end B Pillar.

content.description:
"Sit start on block. Using left pinch and arete sloper make moves out roof to good holds at lip for mantel."

 -SCC topo, Joe at First Avenue Rocks

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Pt31naCYT38
content.location: Lower Area L3 in SCC topo

content.description: Squat start with right hand on side pull, left hand on fragile small edge, and feet on choice of good smears. One-move wonder to a jug and then finish with an unexpectedly hard mantle.
content.protection: 1-2 pads maybe spotter for mantle at grade.
content.location: In the middle of the boulder face, climber's left of Hero V3. Adjacent to Nosey V1. Facing Element Arete V2.

climbs.name: One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest

content.description: Start on side pull pockets. Move up more pockets with sharp edges to small ledge. Make a move for the round top. Tops out around the highest point of this side of the boulder.
content.location: On Chicken Strips Boulder with in Hero Boulder cluster on left side of Lower Area relative to approach.

content.description:
"Using ephemeral slopers will yourself to right hand gaston and continue trending right. Top out." 

  -SCC topo, Joe at First Avenue Rocks
content.location: Lower Area G3 in SCC topo

content.description: Moderate sequence on crimps to start, use undercling side pull, bump out to lip and work your magic.. recreating the feet first exit featured on the notorious "Jesus Slaves" V10/V11.*Beta is avoidable but climb is an intended eliminate, essentially “forcing” beta. Beta:  youtube.com/watch?v=Rct3nOk…
content.protection: A couple pads should be fine.
content.location: Located on the same boulder as "Scarecrow", in the lower area.

content.description:

  -SCC topo, Joe at First Avenue Rocks

content.description:
"Start on crimps at seam with high left heel. Negotiate short roof to powerful mantel. Traversing right to the jug is not the problem." 

  -SCC topo, Joe at First Avenue Rocks

  Labeled as K1 on map, but K2 in written portion. Only problem on this boulder (so far).

content.description: Climbs arete. Left hand crimp side pull waist height on arete, right hand good jug lower on right of arete. Move up and top out with crimps and others.
content.location: On arete on boulder diagonally opposite from Hero V3. In grouping of boulders on left most side of Lower Area from main approach.

content.description: Sit start under Arête and climb up blunt pocketed holds.
content.location: lower area across from “Cobble”

content.description:
Sit start 5 feet left of arete on giant low jug. Traverse overhung on giant jugs to the right and climb out the right side of the arete with a reach and good holds.

 "Climb overhang to easy mantel."

 -SCC topo, Joe at First Avenue Rocks

content.description: This is the Third section of the main bouldering area near the barn. Lotta problems and grades with good sandstone and conglomerate.
